meanings.definition: To spread or smear (a substance) thinly or unevenly on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was daubing paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The artist was daubing colors on the palette.
meanings.sent3: The child was daubing mud on the walls, pretending to be a painter.
meanings.sent4: The chef was daubing sauce on the dish with precision.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was daubing fertilizer on the plants, ensuring they grow well.

meanings.definition: An act or instance of daubing.
meanings.sent1: The daubing of colors on the wall brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: Her daubing of makeup made her look different.
meanings.sent3: The daubing of frosting on the cake was messy but fun.
meanings.sent4: The daubing of glue on the paper held the pieces together.
meanings.sent5: His daubing of ink on the paper created a unique pattern.
